page.title: 17RECREATION/HORSE RIDING.
page.content: {Horse Riding}is popular in this part of the country but there are no public riding stables.It is mostly the farm- ing comunity that own horses, grazing them on their pasture land and bedding the animals in comfortable stables. Riders are often to be seen trotting round the country lanes, or practising jumps in the fields nearer to home, and the horse-box is quite a common vehicle here. Some riders belong to the{Ashford Valley Hunt} and "Hunter trials" are sometimes held on local farm land. Other riders, both senior and junior, are involved in events like Show jumping and Point-to-point races which take place further afield. A side product of Stables is of course Horse manure - and this can be purchased by the bag (often at the roadside) to enrich the garden.
